isis.stitle: TSI 02-16-06 - HVAC Air Intake Scoop Design Improvement

subjectgroup.subject: HVAC Air Intake Scoop Design Improvement

geninfo.para: Under certain operating conditions, the 5600i HVAC system may not produce sufficient air flow to the cab. The addition of the HVAC Inlet Scoop Kit will improve the overall system air flow performance.

partsinfo.para: Scoop, HVAC, Air Intake Kit, Part Number 3577982C91

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: Important: The new intake scoop, as shipped, has a coating that is not adequate for service and must be properly primed and painted prior to use. Without a protective coating the scoop will fade, chalk, and may become brittle over time.

warning.para: To prevent eye injury, always wear safety glasses when drilling, dissembling or assembling components.

step1.para: Locate the new intake scoop over the HVAC inlet screen located on the passenger side of the front cowl. Make certain that the mounting holes in the scoop line up with the four rivets as shown in Figure 1.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Mark Four Rivet Holes Shown with Arrows

step1.para: Mark the four rivets indicated in Figure 1. Remove the scoop.
Center punch the rivet mandrels from each rivet identified in Step 2.
Remove the four rivets by drilling carefully or by chiseling the heads with an appropriate size chisel and hammer.
Position the scoop using two 1/4-14 x 1 sheet metal screws and washers supplied in the kit. Tighten enough to assure that the scoop is in the right location.
Mark the two additional holes that require drilling shown in Figure 2.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Arrows Indicate Hole Locations to be Drilled

step1.para: Remove the scoop and center punch the two marked holes.
Drill the two center punched holes with a 3/16" drill bit.

Position the upper gasket (Filler) utilizing the two holes drilled in the previous step as positioning guides. The filler gasket has an adhesive backing on the cowl side so make certain that it is properly aligned as it is placed into position. See Figure 3.
Reposition the scoop as in Figure 2 and install the six screws and flat washers through the scoop and fasten the scoop to the side of cowl.
